Identification_Area.title: VOYAGER 2 JUPITER POSITION RESAMPLED DATA 48.0 SECONDS

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: DESSLER, A.J. ED., PHYSICS OF JOVIAN MAGNETOSPHERE, CAMBRIDGE UNIVERSITY PRESS, LONDON, APPENDIX B - COORDINATE SYSTEMS, DESSLER, A.J., 1983.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: VOYAGER 2 JUPITER POSITION RESAMPLED DATA 48.0 SECONDS
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: VOYAGER 2 JUPITER POSITION RESAMPLED DATA 48.0 SECONDS
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set includes Voyager 2 Jupiter encounter position data that have been generated at a 48.0 second sample rate using the NAIF SPICE kernals. The data set is composed of 4 columns: 1) ctime - this column contains the data acquisition time. The time is always output in the ISO standard spacecraft event time format (yyyy-mm-dd-Thh:mm:ss.sss) but is stored internally in Cline time which is measured in seconds after 00:00:00.000 Jan 01, 1966, 2) r - this column contains the radial distance from Jupiter in Rj = 71398 km, 3) longitude - this column contains the east longitude of the spacecraft in degrees, 4) latitude - this column contains the latitude of the spacecraft in degrees. Position data is given in Minus System III coordinates.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= This data set includes Voyager 2 Jupiter encounter position data that have been generated at a 48.0 second sample rate using the NAIF SPICE kernals. The data set is composed of 4 columns: 1) ctime - this column contains the data acquisition time. The time is always output in the ISO standard spacecraft event time format (yyyy-mm-dd-Thh:mm:ss.sss) but is stored internally in Cline time which is measured in seconds after 00:00:00.000 Jan 01, 1966, 2) r - this column contains the radial distance from Jupiter in Rj = 71398 km, 3) longitude - this column contains the east longitude of the spacecraft in degrees, 4) latitude - this column contains the latitude of the spacecraft in degrees. Position data is given in Minus System III coordinates.
Processing Level Id : 4 Software Flag : Y Processing Start Time : 1988-09-21 Processing Stop Time : UNK
Parameters ========== Sampling Parameter Name : TIME Data Set Parameter Name : POSITION VECTOR Sampling Parameter Resolution : 48.000000 Minimum Sampling Parameter : 19770820120000.000000 Maximum Sampling Parameter : UNK Sampling Parameter Interval : 48.000000 Minimum Available Sampling Int : 48.000000 Sampling Parameter Unit : SECOND
Description ----------- A position vector is a triad which describes the location of a point in 3-space relative to some origin.
Source Instrument Parameters ============================ N/A
Measurement Information ======================= N/A
Processing ========== N/A
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Overview ======== This dataset was generated using the NAIF SPICE S and P kernals for Voyager 2 at Jupiter; there is no reason to believe that there are problems with the dataset.
